p: Influenza A virus (IAV) can infect a wide range of warm-blooded animals, including birds, pigs, horses, and humans. In humans, the viruses cause respiratory disease and be transmitted by inhalation of virus-containing dust particles or aerosols [ 1]. Severe IAV infection can cause lung inflammation and acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS), which may lead to mortality. Thus, causing many influenza epidemics and pandemics, IAV has been a threat to public health for decades [ 2].
